artist: Artist: Philip Gallo; Printer: Hermetic Press, Minneapolis; Publisher: Hermetic Press, Minneapolis
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description: a. At home with paper rock scissors, 1975, Hermetic Press, Minneapolis b. Concrete poem number one, 1970, Hermetic Press, Nacodoches, Texas; Ed: 4/75 c. Three views of the sky's the limit / a poem in the form of a kaleidoscope, 1975, with three photographs by Ned Gardner, H. 4 3/8 x W. 4 3/8 in., Hermetic Press, Minneapolis (75 copies printed) d. A concrete poem, 1975; Ed.: 1/50, 4 sheets, H. 7 W. 3 1/8 in. each; acetate overlay 7 1/2 x 3 7/8 in., text is printed from two Benday dot screens, Hermetic Press, Minneapolis e. Laura, 1974; screenprint from Letraset Palace Script (Stephenson Blake), Hermetic Press, Minneapolis (75 copies printed) Cover sheet enclosed, dedicated to Harry Duncan
provenance: Philip Gallo, Minneapolis; sold to MIA, 1977.
title: Four Concrete Poems and a Reconstruction of a Fifth
